HeaderInstruction: Pick the original and edited JSON files, then generate a Vintage Story patch file.
SourceTooltip: Select the original file (baseline) the app will compare against. If 'Infer from source path' is enabled, this file must be somewhere under assets/<domain>/... so the patch file id can be detected.
EditedTooltip: Select your edited version of the same JSON file (with your changes applied).
OutputWatermark: Where to save the generated patches .json…
OutputTooltip: Choose where the generated patch file should be saved.
SideTooltip: Choose which side the patch should apply to. “Both” omits the side field so the patch applies everywhere.
ArrayModeTooltip: How to handle JSON arrays when generating operations.
TargetFileIdTooltip:
This becomes the patch 'file' field, like game:... or yourmod:...

If 'Infer from source path' is enabled, this is filled in automatically based on an assets/<domain>/... folder in the source path.
InferFileIdTooltip:
Enabled: the app requires the source file to be somewhere under assets/<domain>/... and uses that to build the patch file id.
Disabled: you can pick the source file from anywhere, but you must type the target file id yourself.
AutoDependsTooltip: If enabled, the app will add a dependsOn entry based on the patch file domain. For the “game” domain, nothing is added.
PreferAddMergeTooltip: If enabled, uses the “addmerge” op instead of “add” when creating keys. This tends to be more compatible across Vintage Story versions.
ErrPickValidSource: Please pick a valid source JSON file.
ErrPickValidEdited: Please pick a valid edited JSON file.
ErrPickOutput: Please choose an output path for the patch file.
ErrInferFileId: Couldn't infer the file id from the source path. Make sure it contains an 'assets/<domain>/...' segment.
ErrPickValidFileId: Please enter a valid target file id like 'game:...' or 'yourmod:...'.
HelpText:
Patch side
• Server: patch runs only on the server.
• Client: patch runs only on the client.
• Both: no side is written, so the patch applies everywhere.

Array mode

• Index-by-index: compares arrays element-by-element. This is the most compatible choice, especially with Prefer addmerge enabled. Great for patching files that other mods might also touch.

• Replace whole arrays: replaces the entire array whenever it changes. Useful when the array is basically “yours” (your own mod content or something unlikely to be patched by others).
FolderCompareTooltip: Compare two folders of JSON files and write only the changed patch files into the output folder.
